subject: Communication
title: Display Rules: When to Show Emotion
description: A fast breakdown of Display Rules: When to Show Emotion for builders.

hook.text: A Japanese student aces an exam and barely smiles. An American student screams with joy.

buildup.text: Display rules are cultural norms that dictate when, where, and how much emotion you should show.

discovery.text: Ekman found that Japanese and Americans showed the same expressions alone â€” but the Japanese masked them in groups.

twist.text: Masking doesn't mean they feel less. It means the culture values group harmony over individual expression.

climax.text: Misreading display rules causes conflict: Americans see Japanese restraint as coldness; Japanese see American.

punchline.text: Same feeling. Different permission to show it.

quiz.question: What are display rules?
options: Cultural norms for when and how to show emotion
